conclusion: Consider principles of electromagnetic induction and Lorentz force.
Induced EMF is calculated as \( \mathcal{E} = B \cdot L \cdot v \).
Total resistance in the circuit is \( R_{\text{total}} = \frac{R}{2} \).
Current in the circuit is \( I = \frac{2B \cdot L \cdot v}{R} \).
Ampere force on the rod is \( F = \frac{2B^2 \cdot L^2 \cdot v}{R} \).
Joule heat \( Q \) relates to energy dissipation but not directly to initial force calculation.
